meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Kerry Tymchuk Colette Perry Tom Neven Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #1168.

td.p: Kerry Tymchuk, an attorney originally from Reedsport, Oregon
Colette Perry, a data processing manager from Chagrin Falls, Ohio
Tom Neven, an editor from Wayne, New Jersey (whose 1-day cash winnings total $12,601)

tr.td: FRENCH HISTORY
ABBREVIATIONS
FINE CHINA
MYSTERIES
LETTERS IN SONG
JEOPARDY! CATEGORIES

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_5_5', 'clue_DJ_5_5_stuck', '(Kerry: No idea.)
(Alex: No idea? "What is [*]?" A curved edge. So you wind up with--)
[ERRATUM: $400 is deducted from Colette\'s score, but is fixed immediately.]
(Alex: --$5,200, and Colette\'s score is changing even as we speak, so we\'ll verify the scores during the commercial break.)

a scallop

Kerry
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Colette: What are conveniences?)
...
(Alex: Colette, you had the right idea, but it was [*]. You had to remember the author here was Mark Twain. Kerry, you get to pick again.)
(Kerry: Well, I guess we\'ll go with SEASHELLS for $1,000.)
(Alex: And it\'s the last Daily Double, and the last clue in the round.)

inconveniences

Colette
Triple Stumper
')

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Tom
Colette
Kerry

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex [as the "Think!" music finishes and fades]: Colette, we\'re gonna begin with you in the middle; all 3 of our contestants uh, wrote down their responses rather quickly on that one. Let\'s find out if that\'s a good sign or a bad one.)
ColetteWhat is Peter Pan?
$2,500
TomWHAT IS PETER PAN
$5,099
KerryWHAT IS PETER PAN
$5,001
Peter Pan')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'This NBC special was performed live in 1955 & 1956; videotaped in 1960; & re-run in \'63, \'66, \'78 & \'89')

tr.td: TELEVISION
This NBC special was performed live in 1955 & 1956; videotaped in 1960; & re-run in '63, '66, '78 & '89
Tom
Colette
Kerry
2nd place: a trip to Honolulu via Continental Airlines
3rd place: a Sherwood stereo system + a complete Nintendo Entertainment system featuring the Family & Junior editions of Jeopardy! & Wheel of Fortune
New champion: $10,201
Tom
Colette
Kerry

18 R
(including 1 DD),
5 W

20 R,
5 W
(including 2 DDs)

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
